generated_json.title: Assessment
content: The patient has recurrent radicular symptoms at L4-L5, consistent with lumbar disc disease. Differential diagnoses include lumbar radiculopathy due to disc degeneration or facet joint arthropathy. Pertinent positive findings include bilateral buttock and hip pain, positive history of gabapentin use with symptom recurrence, and imaging showing L4-L5 disc space narrowing with retroesophageal prominence. No red flags were identified. The condition is stable with current treatment. No significant comorbidities noted.
generated_json.instruction:
Provide a detailed note of the patient's current health status based on the information gathered during the visit. This should be in a single paragraph:
Diagnosis or Differential Diagnosis: List the primary diagnosis or possible diagnoses based on the assessment. Include a differential diagnosis if there is uncertainty or multiple potential causes.
Pertinent Positive and Negative Findings: Highlight key findings from the patient's history, physical examination, and diagnostic tests that support the diagnosis or influence the treatment plan.
Severity or Progression: Describe the severity of the condition, if applicable, and any changes observed since the last visit.
Comorbidities: Note any other existing medical conditions that may impact the patient's current health status or treatment plan.

generated_json.title: Plan
